      • closeEvent

        public void closeEvent()
        Event actived upon clicking the "Close" button on the scene. Closes the stage.

      • saveFileEvent

        public void saveFileEvent()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Event actived upon clicking the "Save" button. Opens a save dialog which allows the user to specify the file name and location for the .rle file the user wants to save the active data in. If there is an active file open, specifiec under the "File path" list location, the file and the locaiton of this file exists on the active computer, this file is automatically overwritten allowing the user to quickly save any changes to the active file without going through a save dialog window. If everyone goes right and it returns a valid file, specified in the returnFile parameter, this file is sent to the saveFile(File returnFile) method which handles the writing of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saveAsEvent

        public void saveAsEvent()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method works similaryily to the saveEvent() method, only this method will open a save dialog where the user has the option to speicfy the name and the location of file, no matter what active file may already be loaded. The File returnFile is sent to the saveFile(File returnFile) which handles the writing of the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saveFile

        public void saveFile(java.io.File returnFile)
              throws java.io.IOException
        This method builds a String based upon what contents may be in the text fields, text areas and labels, representing the specifications of the file. The String is built after standard RLE formatting rules, where values are represented as follows: #N Title String #O Origin String *C Comments String. May be multiple lines. Rules = BXX/SXX Dimensions = x = XX / y = XX The board is counted and represented for each horizontal line where XXo represents the amount of alive cells following each other, XXb representing the amount of dead cells following each other $ represents the end of a row and ! represents the end of the last line on the board. The reading and String result of the reading of the Board is handled separately by the readBoardToString() method. When the writing of the file is complete, the user is notified of its success with the name and location of the file. This file is then read by the readFile method in the FileManagement model class, which sets the saved file as the actively loaded file.
        Parameters:
        returnFile -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readBoardToString

        public java.lang.String readBoardToString()
        Reads the board and a builds a String following standard RLE formatting rules. The board is counted and represented for each horizontal line where XXo represents the amount of alive cells following each other, XXb representing the amount of dead cells following each other $ represents the end of a row and ! represents the end of the last line on the board.
        Returns:

      • drawAllCanvasesStatic

        public void drawAllCanvasesStatic(int boardWidth,
                                  int boardHeight,
                                  byte[][] board,
                                  int height,
                                  int width)
        Draws all canvases when a static board is being previewed. The main board represents the active board on the main stage, while each preview canvas represents one generation after another. For each preview canvas, nextBoard is being run one time through the nextGenerationStatic method, which result is drawn onto their respective canvases.
        Parameters:
        boardWidth - Represents the amount of cells on the height of the board.
        boardHeight - Represents the amount of cells on the widt of the board.
        board - The active board, copied from the main stage.
        height - Represents the amount of cells on the height of the board.
        width - Represents the amount of cells on the widt of the board.

      • drawAllCanvasesDynamic

        public void drawAllCanvasesDynamic(int boardWidth,
                                   int boardHeight,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte>> board,
                                   int height,
                                   int width)
        Draws all canvases when a dynamic board is being previewed. The main board represents the active board on the main stage, while each preview canvas represents one generation after another. For each preview canvas, nextBoard is being run one time through the nextGenerationDynamic method, which result is drawn onto their respective canvases.
        Parameters:
        boardWidth - Represents the amount of cells on the height of the board.
        boardHeight - Represents the amount of cells on the widt of the board.
        board - The active board, copied from the main stage.
        height - Represents the amount of cells on the height of the board.
        width - Represents the amount of cells on the widt of the board.

      • calculateCellSize

        public double calculateCellSize(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas,
                                int height,
                                int width)
        Calculates the size each cells needs to have in order to fit in the canvas the method gets as input.
        Parameters:
        canvas - Input parameter representing the canvas to be calculated based on.
        height - Input parameter representing the amount of cells on the height of the board that needs to fit in the canvas.
        width - Input parameter representing the amount of cells on the width of the board that needs to fit in the canvas.
        Returns:
        Returns the cell size as a double value.

      • drawStatic

        public void drawStatic(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                       double cellSize,
                       javafx.scene.paint.Color aliveCellColor,
                       javafx.scene.paint.Color deadCellColor,
                       byte[][] board,
                       int height,
                       int width)
        Draws the canvas based on the input parameters. Goes through the board in a loop and fills each cell based on its value and with the corresponding color with a fillRect.
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context of the canvas.
        cellSize - The size each cells needs
        aliveCellColor - The color each alive cell shall be drawn in.
        deadCellColor - The color each dead cell shall be drawn in.
        board - The board the draw function is based upon.
        height - The height of the board the function is called upon.
        width - The width of the board the function is called upon.

      • drawDynamic

        public void drawDynamic(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                        javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas,
                        double cellSize,
                        javafx.scene.paint.Color aliveCellColor,
                        javafx.scene.paint.Color deadCellColor,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte>> board,
                        int height,
                        int width)
        Draws the canvas based on the input parameters. Goes through the board in a loop and fills each cell based on its value and with the corresponding color with a fillRect.
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context of the canvas.
        cellSize - The size each cells needs
        aliveCellColor - The color each alive cell shall be drawn in.
        deadCellColor - The color each dead cell shall be drawn in.
        board - The board the draw function is based upon.
        height - The height of the board the function is called upon.
        width - The width of the board the function is called upon.

      • nextGenerationStatic

        public byte[][] nextGenerationStatic(byte[][] evolvingBoard,
                                     int height,
                                     int width)
        Loops through every cell and counts the amount of live neighbor cells in each direction. The next status of each cell is put in the nextBoard array, and what this status should be is based on the rules currently in use in the GoL class. At the end of the loops, the evolvedBoard is set to be the new currentBoard. This is done in order to avoid mix of data between the old, and the new state of the board, which would result in false patterns. For static boards.

      • nextGenerationDynamic

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte>> nextGenerationDynamic(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte>> evolvingBoard,
                                                                                      int height,
                                                                                      int width)
        Loops through every cell and counts the amount of live neighbor cells in each direction. The next status of each cell is put in the nextBoard array, and what this status should be is based on the rules currently in use in the GoL class. At the end of the loops, the evolvedBoard is set to be the new currentBoard. This is done in order to avoid mix of data between the old, and the new state of the board, which would result in false patterns. For dynamic boards.
